discourse_list.title: [\xf0\x9f\x93\x84] Collateral Onboarding Call #5: New Silver + 6s Capital - Wednesday, August 12 17:00 UTC

content.content: Dial In Details Zoom Call Passcode: 314223 Intro This is the first of our regularly scheduled bi-weekly collateral onboarding call to discuss potential assets for MCD open for anyone to join and present. For questions, discussions and feedback on the call, please check out this thread Agenda Zoom Call // Passcode: 314223 2020-08-12T17:00:00Z Intro by @_LS and @spin Presentation 1: New Silver Presentation by @prankstr25 on New Silver’s Collateral Application Followed by a discussion Presenter 2: @mrabino1 on building a Credit Tenant Lease Marketplace for Maker @mrabino1 will present the structure he proposes in the following thread: How MakerDAO can be a competitive lender in the Credit Tenant Lease marketplace Call Summary Will be provided here after the call as time allows.

I’d encourage people who are available and interested to attend. Real world collateral is going to require some knowledge and adjustment as we figure out how to work with it effectively. If you’re not able to attend, feel free to contribute questions and those present will try to get them answered.
The waiting room is on, so if you don’t get in, please post in the Maker Chat governance and risk channel!
Call summary coming soon, but recording is up: https://youtu.be/E0ekD33FHCo

spin:  Will be provided here after the call as time allows.   Episode #05: August 12th, 2020 Agenda   00:00: Introduction with Lucas Vogelsang  02:30: New Silver with Kirill Bensonoff  14:30: Q&A and Discussion about New Silver  32:00: 6s Capital with Matthew Rabinowitz  43:42: Q&A and Discussion about 6s Capital  Video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E0ekD33FHCo Introduction Lucas Vogelsang Agenda and Preamble 00:00  Introducing a new format for the collateral onboarding call. This started when the MIPs process was introduced, and after a break, we’re kicking them off again. We’re experimenting with two 10-minute presentations from two different community members, followed by a 20-minute discussion for each presentation. Today we have real estate as a bigger theme. Matt and Kirill will introduce two different types of collateral types or ideas for collateral. Discussions about collateral happen in the Forum.   New Silver Kirill Bensonoff  New Silver Forum Thread  Presentation 02:30 Cover Slide1223×675 81.5 KB Overview1205×521 434 KB Opportunity1285×503 239 KB Solution/Strategy1067×673 408 KB Technology1399×598 345 KB Overview of Loan Process1232×725 172 KB New Silver Home1387×701 155 KB New Silver Property1370×696 257 KB New Silver Process1051×572 131 KB Discussion  14:30 - Planet_X: Is the Dai being out of peg a problem for New Silver? What are the effects? 17:11 - Frank Cruz: Was New Silver around 10~15 years ago? I feel that I’ve heard the company name before. 17:38 - Frank Cruz: Are you registered in all 50 states? 18:02 - Vitaly R: What would the liquidation process would look like in the context of MakerDAO? 20:47 - Lev: Would MakerDAO take the senior tranches? Could you please expand on that? 23:22 - Juan: Can an investor invest in the New Silver Vault and take part of the risk and profits or in this case it would only be MakerDAO? 25:52- Planet_X: As far as I understand, ERC1404 is like an ERC20 token, where you could limit the addresses that receive the token. Maybe you could look into it.  30:03 - LongForWisdom: Can you give an estimate of the amount of the senior tranch loans that you could generate through the Maker Protocol? 31:04 - Lucas Vogelsang: What’s the time of an average loan?  6s Development Matthew Rabinowitz  6s Capital Forum Thread  Presentation 32:00 Cover Slide1293×728 201 KB Peter Drucker1290×726 90 KB External Centrlized Lending1290×725 159 KB Central Bank1293×727 136 KB Why does this matter?1293×721 61.7 KB Current Dai Market1287×725 74.6 KB DeFi yield farming1302×721 157 KB Edge of pool1282×717 74.9 KB Why is this critical?1291×721 152 KB Recommendation1289×722 148 KB What does that mean?1294×726 150 KB Commercial Real Estate1290×728 147 KB Starting Requirements1291×727 182 KB Equity Contribution1284×718 129 KB A gun to the head1291×722 181 KB Singular greatest issues1290×725 144 KB Structure1286×723 84.7 KB Structure with Maker1288×724 130 KB Centralizing Processes1287×721 99.7 KB Risk Teams1288×720 110 KB Components needed1288×720 116 KB 6s Capital Executive Summary1318×760 98.6 KB Philosophy1292×725 139 KB Organizational Structure1292×724 91.6 KB Process1288×721 108 KB Money Movement1289×723 98 KB Key Takeaway1291×724 163 KB Risk Analysis1288×722 121 KB Best of Both Worlds1292×725 124 KB Resistant1290×721 94.4 KB Discussion  43:42 - Martin: Who is the signing the credit facility agreement for Maker with 6s Capital? 44:45 - Sébastien Deriveaux: Can a DAO sign a contract? 45:17 - LongForWisdom: The DAO needs to trust the representative then? 46:00 - Lucas Vogelsang: Could the Community elect 20 entities to be part of this trust? How many honest participants would you need? 47:06 - Lucas Vogelsang: You said that the people should be uncomfortable holding Dai or having a Dai debt in this scenario? 49:22 - Sébastien Deriveaux: Do you have any idea of the amount you want to borrow? 49:44 - LongForWisdom: In terms of outstanding borrowers at any one time, what is that roughly? 50:42 - Sébastien Deriveaux: How much equity can you put in the SPV? 51:09 - Will Remor: In terms of the credit quality, because it’s a revolving loan facility, it’s very important to monitor of the credit quality, as it might be changing. How could Maker be assured that you’re actually monitoring the credit quality of the underlying facilities? 52:48 - Will Remor: Would it be acceptable that the interest rate that is charged is dynamically set rather than dynamically set? 54:06 - Will Remor: I think it’s very important that all the information is available, so that the pricing mechanism can be set right every time. 57:45 - Lucas Vogelsang: You’re talking about backup servicing companies that do this as well like in a traditional credit world, where you can have third party servicer that can take over a portfolio of loans if the operating company is going bankrupt? 59:31 - Sébastien Deriveaux: For both projects we’re talking about fixed rates, right?  Closing Comments Lucas Vogelsang Outro 1:00:25  Thanks, everyone, for joining. We’ll do another one in two weeks. Same time. Open for suggestions on new topics, new collateral types, and feedback on format. There’s a Forum Thread on these calls. Also, if you want to continue the conversation on:  New Silver Forum Thread 6s Capital Forum Thread   Let’s keep going the conversation there, and I hope to see you in two weeks.  Credits  Juan Guillen produced this summary. Everyone who spoke and presented on the call, listed in the headers.
